course_title: Community and Public Health Nutrition Principles for Dietetics

learning_outcomes.description: Further develop individual perspectives on contemporary behaviour change and co-design methods
Evaluate how health service design supports Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples to attain equitable health outcomes
Articulate the ability to plan, implement and evaluate nutrition education promotions and/or programs
Analyse how quality management principles are applied to public health and community nutrition
Apply an ethically responsible, culturally safe and culturally responsive approach to public health and community nutrition challenges

assessments.task_description:
This assessment task should be completed after engaging with Modules 2 & 3 of the Cultural Safety in Practice modules on Blackboard. This task requires you to reflect on your learnings from the modules and how you will apply your knowledge of culturally safe practice in dietetics practice.

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) 

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant ePortfolio submission link via the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Quiz 1 will cover workshop content from weeks 1-3

Quiz 2 will cover workshop content from weeks 4 and 5

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) 

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date:
28/04/2026 1:00 pm

Presentations will be delivered in person during the timetabled workshop. Needs Assessment and Presentation Slides must be submitted by 1:00 pm on the day of the workshop, prior to the commencement of the session.
assessments.task_description:
This is a group assessment task. This assessment task requires you to complete a needs assessment for a Primary Health Network using relevant secondary data. You will also be required to deliver a presentation summarising the findings of your needs assessment.

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) 

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The Needs Assessment, and a PDF copy of presentation slides, are to be submitted via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This assessment task requires you to apply your knowledge of co-design, behaviour change and science communication to co-design a nutrition resource for university students, and a social media post to launch and promote uptake of the resource.

Use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) 

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
